冤仇.definition: rancor; enmity; hatred resulting from grievances

冤假錯案.definition: unjust, fake and false charges (in a legal case)

冤冤相報何時了.pinyin: yuān yuān xiāng bào hé shí le
冤冤相報何時了.definition: if revenge breeds revenge, will there ever be an end to it? (Buddhist saying)

冤大頭.definition: spendthrift and foolish; sb with more money than sense

冤孽.definition: sin (in Buddhism); enmity leading to sin

冤家.definition: enemy; foe; (in opera) sweetheart or destined love

冤家宜解不宜結.pinyin: yuān jiā yí jiě bù yí jié
冤家宜解不宜結.definition: It is better to squash enmity rather than keeping it alive (proverb)

冤家路窄.definition: lit. for enemies, the road is narrow (idiom); fig. rivals inevitably cross paths

冤情.definition: facts of an injustice; circumstances surrounding a miscarriage of justice

冤有頭，債有主.pinyin: yuān yǒu tóu ， zhài yǒu zhǔ
冤有頭，債有主.definition: for every grievance someone is responsible, for every debt there is a debtor (idiom); when settling disputes one should not involve third parties

冤枉.definition: to accuse wrongly; to treat unjustly; injustice; wronged; not worthwhile

冤枉路.definition: pointless trip; not worth the trip

冤業.definition: sin (in Buddhism); enmity leading to sin; also written 冤孽

冤獄.definition: unjust charge or verdict; miscarriage of justice; frame-up

冤苦.definition: to treat (sb) unjustly; anguish caused by an injustice

冤錢.definition: money spent in vain; wasted money

冤魂.definition: ghost of one who died unjustly; departed spirit demanding vengeance for grievances
